description.$t:
**Update on July 29, 2016: Sammy is still searching for his special someone, in foster care in Toronto**

Meet Sammy! Sammy was found as a stray, and was picked up by a volunteer from the rescue and made his way to Canada last fall.  Sammy is a lot of dog packed into a solid, slightly dachshund-y body. He's energetic and super intelligent, and he can be lots of fun! He loves lots of physical and mental stimulation. In his current home, he frequently goes on runs and walks in the ravine. He's a great hiking companion and would love something like a scenting or recreational agility class!

Sammy has been evaluated by a professional trainer, and she describes him as âa big working dog in a small dogâs body,â and he needs the right kind of family -- one that is committed to working with him on an ongoing basis, that has a lot of patience, and will provide the leadership he needs to reach his full potential.  Sammy is not an aggressive dog, but can be dominant and therefore requires a human with dog handling experience as he is inclined to guard his resources, toys and beloved humans, especially in his home environment. He can be reactive on leash around other dogs, and he has bitten when he felt his territory was encroached upon, but he has flourished in foster care with training and guidance.

We are looking for an experienced guardian or guardians, and a home with no small children. A home with another canine may work, a female is preferred, and it would be contingent upon a successful trial period.  Despite these challenges, this guy is a wonderful, comical and engaging little dude, who and would make a loving and very rewarding companion in the right home.  And did we mention he's smart as a whip? With that enormous head, how could he not be?

A Delcie & Lilly update: If you like hounds, youâll love the âHoundie Girlsâ. They have been in our home as fosters since November 2013. While they are around 14 years old, they didnât âget the memoâ that they are senior dogs. They love a good walk, just like their 5 year old foster sister. In fact, Delcie bounces around like a puppy whenever the leash is brought out. They live for their walks and enjoy backyard time, although preferably with a sweater during a winter like the last one! In our home the houndies are the 2nd half to a foursome, and get along well with our two dogs, one senior and one youngster. They arenât keen on public âmeet-upsâ at the dog park or HBR events. Like many floppy eared breeds, the girls are plagued by chronic ear issues. Regular cleaning and strategic upkeep seems to maintain their comfort, but the amount of scarring makes for a chronic condition. They are not keen on ear cleaning or nail trimming. The âHoundiesâ maintain their hounding ways, engaging in the odd sampling of garbage if available and love table scraps, taking advantage of any opportunity. They enjoy engaging in regular âchoir practiceâ, howling in unison with foster dad, and make for a great alarm system in the house! The ladies would prefer to lounge on the furniture, but the foster parents encourage dog beds, and the girls oblige. âHounding Hourâ can happen anywhere, they are happiest when with their people, relaxing or walking. These two ladies have personality plus and are truly lovable, Lilly waves with her paw when you come to talk to her, Delcie wags the tip of her tail when spoken (or sung) to. Perhaps you would like a âHounding Hourâ at your house? Delcie and Lilly would be happy to join you.

"Hi there. My name is Hope. I am up to date with vaccines and spayed. I am a 1 year old Mastiff X (foster mom says Husky!) who for whatever reason, landed myself in a shelter. Thankfully, Homeward Bound rescued me and gave me a chance to find my forever family. My foster mom says that I am a big cuddle bug who will actually wrap my paws around you and close my eyes to give you as big a hug as possible. I am always at my foster humans' feet and love to be around them as much as possible. Given that I am part Husky, I LOVE the outdoors! I love to play and run and chase my foster brother around the yard. I am quite the jumper and runner given my lean physique and "mush dog" genes and would certainly need a high, fenced in yard to avoid me jumping the fence and getting lost. I am house trained but sometimes get so excited when my foster humans come home that I accidentally piddle a little bit. Sorry...I am still quite young and excitable. This will change as I mature I'm sure of it. I am a little nervous when first meeting new dogs and can get a little agitated if I am introduced too quickly and not given time to adjust. I do not bite but will certainly let other dogs know that they are bothering me and to back off. I do like my own space and would prefer to be around humans rather than other dogs. I definitely do not like dominant male dogs and would prefer a home with a more submissive/laid back/smaller dog(s). My foster brother is that kind of dog and we play and cuddle together all the time. I can be a bit whiny if I am left alone. This is also my cue for "I need to go to the bathroom". I am crate trained and do just fine in a crate. My foster mom tells me I have an excellent recall and am doing fantastic with leash training (she says I'm much smarter than my foster brother but I'm not allowed to tell him she said that). I am continuing to learn manners and recently learned how to "roll over" in minutes, but only for peanut butter. My foster parents are working with me and say I am showing improvements every day-not that I have bad manners I just haven't had much stability and training. As long as I keep getting peanut butter, I will show as many improvements as possible! I am very attached to my 16 year old foster sister (mainly because she lets me sleep in her big comfy bed). Just so I have the best opportunity possible at finding my forever home, I would probably be better off in a home with children over 12 as I have not been around small children to know whether I like them or not. What else can I say...come meet me for a hug :)"

*CROSS POST THIS IS NOT AN HBR DOG PLEASE SEE CONTACT INFO AT BOTTOMHi my name is Maggie but sometime my mom calls me moo moo. I am a sweet and loving 2 1/2 year old Old English Bulldog. I love to go on walks and play a good game of tug of war with my rope, but that doesn't mean I don't love snuggling up with a good movie too, cause I really do. I also love.....well everyone, but my mom says that because I'm a tank I'm too rough with babies and toddlers. I don't mean to hurt them I just want to give them lots of slobbery wet kisses. I love to play with my fur brother too, but he's a lot older than me and gets grumpy easily and sometimes I hurt him. So a younger dog for me to play with would be great. I do have allergies but nobody can figure out to what, so sometimes I breakout in a rash, but it's nothing a nice warm bath with baking soda and some benadryl can't fix. And I do love a good bath. My mom thinks I was a golden retriever in my past life cause I love water so much. Maggie is located in Bowmanville please email sweet_74@rogers.com or call (905) 244-7887

Hey HBR Fans,Murphy here .. look at me!! I look like a 4 -legged dog!!! It's going to take some time to get used to having 4 legs!! I will need to build some new muscle so I can walk and run properly on it, but foster mom says I'm up for the challenge! She is sooooo proud of me! Foster mom says I can only wear it three times a day for 20 minutes at a time for now. Just like any kind of exercise, it takes time to get use to and work up some muscle in my shoulder that I never had before.I still have a long way to go, but I'm taking it one paw at a timewink emoticonThe AMAZING people at HBR are still raising money to cover the cost of my prosthetic, so if you could spare a couple dollars to go towards my new leg, I would REALLY appreciate it.You can visit www.homewardboundrescue.ca for ways to donate. You can also go online at www.canadahelps.org and select Homeward Bound Rescue.Murphy is being fostered in Barrie

Hello future family! My name is Alpha but my foster mom says my name should be Zen becauseof my calm nature and because I like to do yoga poses. I love joining my foster family on longwalks, shopping at pet stores, playing with my stuffy chicken or just sitting on the porchwatching the world go by. I love to be with them all the time and would do best in a foreverhome where I have company most of the time. I am happy to be active, cuddle on the couch orsit quietly beside you.I like to go out with them to explore the world. I am comfortable and well behaved when visitingfriends, in crowds at markets, walking along busy streets or hiking trails in the forest. I love tomeet and greet both people and dogs and I am always complemented on my lovely doggymanners and good looks. People have mistaken me for the dog in Disneyâs Homeward Bound.They think Iâm a celebrity!I know my basic commands and I am a quick learner. My foster mom crate trained me in 1week! I love my airline crate and often sit in it quietly waiting for food or to see if the treat fairyleft me a little something. I will do anything for a bit of food!If you are looking for a quiet, well mannered, super smart and loving doggy, Iâm your boy!DUE TO MY SIZE I WILL ONLY GO TO A HOME WITH CHILDREN OVER THE AGE OF 12ALPHA IS CURRENTLY ON PHENOBARBITAL FOR EPILEPSY *Alpha is being fostered in Petawawa*

*ADOPTION PENDING*Hi! My name is Bob, I am a 6 years young, sweet, shy boy who loves to be around my people and fur brothers and sisters. I love to run and sometimes even escape the house to go on adventures! I am gentle with everyone and have never been aggressive towards my humans. I don't really like barking and I never go to the bathroom inside!I do have some special quirks from my puppy mill days, but with a routine these seem to not come about so often. My foster mom says that when I am upset I bump things with my nose off of tables and I pace. I just need some comforting and then I stop. I also require medication to help me with my anxiety which helps.I have lived with other dogs and cats and sometimes I even enjoy a good cat chase but I never hurt them.BOB IS BEING FOSTERED IN AJAX

Hi Paz here, I have been around for quite awhile settling into the foster life but I think its about time I find a family to call my own! Here is a bit about me, then you can tell me all about you :) I was surrendered into HBR care as my person could no longer look after me (this took alot courage for him to do) I am a stunning 3 year old Boxer mix (likely Mastiff) who is 100lbs of pure love ..if I don't say so myselfI love people of all sizes, dogs of all sizes and even his feline friends. I have been fully vetted by the nice people at HBR (thank you) Now for my quirks (we all have them) - I am very strong on leash and require an experienced owner- I think I would do best in a home with children over the age of 12 (because I am so strong)- I would need an owner that doesn't mind working on my leash skillsIf I sound like the guy for you, I would love to hear all about you and your quirks.. remember I am really looking for my furever home!Love PazPaz is being fostered in Port Perry

name.$t: Precious  - LOOKING FOR A FOREVER OR FOSTER HOME

description.$t:
Hi, I'm Precious. Well, I AM cherished here at the EHS, but that's not what I mean â Precious is my name! I'm a slimmer, longer haired version of my sister Coco. I'm as friendly as can be, and love having my long fur combed as I sit next to you on my blankets that are laid out on my various couches. I am easy going and get along with almost everybody, people and cats alike. Coco and I are furry couch potatoes who would keep you company as you read a book, or watch some television. We require some medication, but are otherwise very low maintenance. Come on by the EHS for a casual, care free visit with me and my sister Coco! We hope to see you soon! 

Make it count, save a life, adopt a mature cat.

Our adoption fee  includes: up to date vaccinations, microchip, and spay/ neuter. 

To make an appointment to meet Precious and CoCo or for more information please contact the Etobicoke Humane Society at: 416-249-6100 EXT:301, email: cats@etobicokehumanesociety.com, or fill out our new, easy online cat adoption form at http://etobicokehumanesociety.com/adoption-process/.

name.$t: Coco - LOOKING FOR A FOREVER OR FOSTER HOME

description.$t:
Oh hello! I'm Coco the calico. I'm twelve years young, and perhaps a little larger than I'd like to be, but my heart is just as big, and so is my couch! Older cats like my sister Precious and I are easily over looked. So please give us a moment of your time, and we will show you our extraordinarily friendly natures. The two of us would love nothing more than go together (as we are bonded) to a forever and loving home where we can cuddle up to you on the couch day after day, while you pat our heads and we share our contented purrs. We are tame well behaved girls with easy going temperaments. We are purrfect! And we would love to find the perfect people to accept us and love us no matter what! We'd love to meet you, so swing by and give us a friendly hello! 

Make it count, save a life, adopt a mature cat.

Our adoption fee  includes: up to date vaccinations, microchip, and spay/ neuter. 

To make an appointment to meet CoCo and Precious or for more information please contact the Etobicoke Humane Society at: 416-249-6100 EXT:301, email: cats@etobicokehumanesociety.com, or fill out our new, easy online cat adoption form at http://etobicokehumanesociety.com/adoption-process/.

First things first, ladies and gentlemen, I am not a female My long, soft, luscious hair seems to dissuade people of the notion that I'm male, but believe it, folks! And my brother, with whom I am bonded, is also a male, despite his name, Sasha. I am extremely easy going as I lounge on the computer's keyboard, the top of the fridge,  the windowsill, or wedge myself into the back of a desk. I do go wild for my catnip sausages! I love to lick and chew them, and bat them around, and after that I usually lay contentedly outstretched on my back, awaiting a few belly rubs. We do require daily medication, but that's just like some people! We are pretty good about taking our pills. If you are ready for lounge happy cats, give my brother Sasha and I a visit here at the EHS. We will be wandering the reception area, waiting to greet you upon your arrival. 

Our adoption fee  includes: up to date vaccinations, microchip, and spay/ neuter 

To make an appointment to meet this wonderful cat or for more information please contact the Etobicoke Humane Society at: 416-249-6100 EXT:301 or email: cats@etobicokehumanesociety.com

Good day to you all! I am Sasha, protector of the reception desk here at EHS. I am an affectionate, carefree 8 year old cat who enjoys chasing laser pointers and feathers, not to mention finding  incredibly small, but delightfully satisfying, sleeping spots around the shelter. If we fits, we sits! When I am not sleeping, I love to peer in and look at the kittens in their room - a room that used to be Angel's and mine as a matter of fact . I've heard rumors that some believe I want that room back, but I'll never tell. I've enjoyed my stay here at the EHS for the past year and half as I get to meet all the folks who come in, and get fawned over for my cute face that's too small for my body; but it's truly time that Angel and I found a home to call our own.

Our adoption fee  includes: up to date vaccinations, microchip, and spay/ neuter

To make an appointment to meet this wonderful cat or for more information please contact the Etobicoke Humane Society at: 416-249-6100 EXT:301 or email: cats@etobicokehumanesociety.com

Hello, Iâm Maple. I am very scared right now, having been left in a cardboard box with my sister and brother at the doorstep of EHS â not a great way to start off my 6 month old life, but I know I will mature into a very sweet cat and live up to my namesake. Just like syrup takes time to develop, so do I. If you donât mind helping a scared cat transform into a confident cat who will appreciate you for taking a chance on her, then please donât hesitate to start up a friendship with me. Iâll be here at the EHS, just pop on by. 

Our adoption fee  includes: up to date vaccinations, microchip, and spay/ neuter. 

To make an appointment to meet this wonderful cat or for more information please contact the Etobicoke Humane Society at: 416-249-6100 EXT:301, email: cats@etobicokehumanesociety.com, or fill out our new, easy online cat adoption form at http://etobicokehumanesociety.com/adoption-process/.

breed.$t: Domestic Short Hair - gray and white

description.$t:
Hi there! My name is Chloe. I am a very sweet two and a half year old grey and white kitty. I grew up in a concrete warehouse, which is where I developed problems with a tear duct on my right eye. It's no big deal; I just need someone to wipe away my tears once a day. At EHS, I'm in much better conditions but I'll probably be crying of happiness when someone decides to take me to my forever home. Even though I haven't had the best time growing up, I'm very affectionate and love attention. I'm new here so I'm still a bit shy but just hanging out with me is enough to melt a few hearts. So if you want a sweet little cat that would love to curl up with you on a boring afternoon, I'm just the cat for you!


Our adoption fee  includes: up to date vaccinations, microchip, and spay/ neuter. 

To make an appointment to meet this wonderful cat or for more information please contact the Etobicoke Humane Society at: 416-249-6100 EXT:301 or email: cats@etobicokehumanesociety.com

breed.$t: Domestic Medium Hair - gray and white

description.$t:
Hello, my name is Rocky. I am a very nice 8 year old boy who just wants to live in a nice home. I was found in front of a pet store with my best buddy Rambo. We are really close and make each other feel safe. We were taken in by EHS and are now looking for a place to call our own. I love attention and although I may be very scared at first, it doesn't take me a long time to warm up.  I have badly matted fur on my back and some dental problems.  Like my namesake however, I'm a fighter. I refuse to let these little things bother me. But I'm getting all cleaned up and before I know it, I'll seem like I'm 2. I can't wait to have a home where Rambo and I can relax.
 
Our adoption fee  includes: up to date vaccinations, microchip, and spay/ neuter. 

To make an appointment to meet these wonderful cats or for more information please contact the Etobicoke Humane Society at: 416-249-6100 EXT:301 or email: cats@etobicokehumanesociety.com

Hi, how ya doin'? My name is Rambo and I am a nice, soft, 2 year old boy. I live with my buddy Rocky. We've been through a lot together. There was this one time where some man picked us up when we were living outside and he brought us to EHS. I was really scared. But I had Rocky so it wasn't too bad. I have a hunger for life, and for wet food. You would think I've never eaten. Rocky and I are real nice and if you are nice to us, we'll love you. I love when people scratch under my chin and feed me. I'm not too hard to please. But it would be nice to live somewhere where Rocky and I will be spoiled with love. 

Our adoption fee  includes: up to date vaccinations, microchip, and spay/ neuter. 

To make an appointment to meet this wonderful cat or for more information please contact the Etobicoke Humane Society at: 416-249-6100 EXT:301 or email: cats@etobicokehumanesociety.com

Hey there, I'm Cece. I am 6 years old and I love people. I was dropped off in a carrier outside in the rain. I was there overnight so you would see why I'm a bit shy. As bad as my way of getting here was, I am very friendly. I always greet my visitors with some head butts and a purr whenever someone walks in. I'm not too fond of the cats that pass by but when people pass by, all I want is for them so come and see me. I'm looking for a home with a nice family. I just really want to be your cuddly lap cat.
Our adoption fee  includes: up to date vaccinations, microchip, and spay/ neuter. 

To make an appointment to meet this wonderful cat or for more information please contact the Etobicoke Humane Society at: 416-249-6100 EXT:301 or email: cats@etobicokehumanesociety.com

Hi. My name is Quincy. I am 3 years old. I was rescued from a high kill shelter and I'm in pretty rough shape. Before arriving at the shelter, I was attacked by the other cats a lot so I have some battle scars. Despite that, I'm super gentle and friendly. I'll always greet you with a nice meow. I really love when people visit and come pet me. I may look a little beat up but I'll get better. When I'm feeling better, I can't wait to go to some lovely people in their loving home. It would be nice to know what a family is. If you want to meet me, I'd love to see you!


Our adoption fee  includes: up to date vaccinations, microchip, and spay/ neuter. 

To make an appointment to meet this wonderful cat or for more information please contact the Etobicoke Humane Society at: 416-249-6100 EXT:301 or email: cats@etobicokehumanesociety.com

Hey there Delilah, what's it like at the society? 
Well, it's still pretty scary, but I'm getting used to it fast. I came from the same place as Amanda and I was in the same place. I was on death row as well. I'm not as outgoing as the other cats but I'm still very sweet. Slow and steady wins the race, right? It'll take a little extra effort to help me be comfortable around people but everyone says I'm doing well. I really love being pet, as long as you are nice and gentle, I'll let you pet me for hours. I just need a family that will help my colours shine! I swear that once you take the time to get to know me, I'm pretty great!


Our adoption fee  includes: up to date vaccinations, microchip, and spay/ neuter. 

To make an appointment to meet this wonderful cat or for more information please contact the Etobicoke Humane Society at: 416-249-6100 EXT:301 or email: cats@etobicokehumanesociety.com

Hi. My name is Soria. I am 2 years old and I'm the proud mom of 4 beautiful kittens. They are old enough to live on their own so I am looking to do the same. I'm still quite shy, I was so frazzled for a while that I really didn't know what to do with myself. I am a little more comfortable now, but it'll take time for me to be completely comfy. I know not everyone wants a cat that is shy or scared, but that doesn't mean that I don't deserve a home. I may be shy but I'm really nice once you get to know me. I just need a little extra time. Please try to find room in your home and your heart for a young cat looking for a home. 

Our adoption fee  includes: up to date vaccinations, microchip, and spay/ neuter. 

To make an appointment to meet this wonderful cat or for more information please contact the Etobicoke Humane Society at: 416-249-6100 EXT:301 or email: cats@etobicokehumanesociety.com

Hello, my name is Patchy. I am a 7-year-old boy. I was with my old family for 7 years but, unfortunately, I had to leave because they developed allergies to me. Being brought to the shelter is a scary experience for me. Please don't use my personality right now to judge how I really am. After my family gave me up, I don't have the greatest trust in people. If you take the time to help me get back to the real me, I would love to show you the sweet, gentle and adorable boy that my family fell in love with in the first place.

Our adoption fee  includes: up to date vaccinations, microchip, and spay/ neuter. 

To make an appointment to meet this wonderful cat or for more information please contact the Etobicoke Humane Society at: 416-249-6100 EXT:301 or email: cats@etobicokehumanesociety.com

We recommend you come to the shelter to visit Atticus before submitting an application as this is the first step in the adoption process. Our dog visiting hours are: 10:30 - 11:30 AM, 1:30 - 4:30 PM or by appointment.

Hi my name is Atticus! I am a sweet 10 month old boxer mix pup. I absolutely love to play and I get along well with other dogs! I love to cuddle and get lots of love and attention. I have allergies to certain foods but now that I am getting treatment and only eating the right food they are clearing up nicely and I have stopped scratching. What a relief! Everyone at the shelter is very nice to me and I can tell they really really like me but I would like a home of my own as soon as possible please. I need a patient owner with a quiet lifestyle. I am up to date on all of my shots and will be neutered before I leave - whatever that means. Please come meet me!

For more information on the EHS adoption process please visit our website or email
lkb.ehs@gmail.com for more information.

Maya is a sweet 9 yr old Jack Russell. Do not let her age fool you she is in great shape and loves to play fetch. Maya also loves cuddles and belly rubs. She is a happy gal who is good with dogs, housebroken and walks nicely on a leash. Maya deserves a great home!

For more details regarding the EHS adoption process please visit our shelter or email jleung.ehs@gmail.com with any questions about Maya.

We recommend you come visit him before submitting an application. Our visiting hours are: 10:30 AM to 11:30 AM, 1:30 PM to 4:30 PM or by appointment.

Luke is a handsome 9 month old Collie mix. He is sweet and a little shy. Luke walks nicely on a leash and enjoys interacting with people. He is a real cuddler.  Luke is healthy, neutered and up-to-date on his vaccinations.

For information regarding the EHS adoption process please visit our website or email mgy.ehs@gmail.com with any questions about Luke.

Hi! My name is Ryder and I am a 2 year old Lab/Husky mix. When I first meet people I am a little nervous and shy, especially if they are men, but once I get a chance to know them I really warm up. I arrived at the shelter because someone abandoned me.  I do not understand why. All the volunteers at EHS say I'm so sweet. I may get a little howly, it's the Husky in me, so I would not do well in an apartment or condo. I hope that I will find a patient human that will give me the time to come out of my shell and let me enjoy being a dog.

For details regarding the EHS adoption process please visit our website. If you have any questions about Ryder please email his coordinator at kbr.ehs@gmail.com

Our dog visiting hours are: Daily 10:30 to 11:30 AM, 1:30 to 4:30 PM, or by appointment. 

Milan is a 10 month old mixed breed pup. Her brother is Marseille! Her foster says she is one of the most well-behaved pups that you will ever meet. She has a very good temperament. Although she is a little shy at first, she is very polite and gentle when meeting strangers. Milan is good with all dogs, big and small, and is in a foster home with many dogs. She does well in car rides, loves her daily walks, and enjoys the doggie park.  Milan is also crate trained and house trained. She is a wonderful dog waiting patiently for a loving family.

For more information on the EHS adoption process please visit our website, or for further details on Milan please email ldz.ehs@gmail.com.

Our dog visiting hours are: Daily 10:30 AM to 11:30 AM, 1:30 PM to 4:30 PM or by appointment.

Marseille is a 10 month old mixed breed pup.  His foster says he is one of the most well-behaved pups that you will ever meet. He has a very good temperament.  Although he is a little shy at first, he is very polite and gentle when meeting strangers.  Marseille is good with all dogs, big and small, and is in a foster home with many dogs.  He does well in car rides, loves his daily walks, and enjoys the doggie park.  Marseille is also crate trained and house trained.  He is a wonderful dog waiting patiently for a loving family.   

For more information on the EHS adoption process please visit our website, or for further details please email ldz.ehs@gmail.com.

We recommend you visit Cisco before submitting an application. Visiting hours are daily between 10:00-11:30am and 1:30-4:30pm.

Cisco is a 1 year old, small to medium, mixed breed pup. He is friendly with a very good temperament. Cisco is good with all dogs, big and small. He does well on car rides, loves his daily walks, and enjoys the dog park.  Cisco is also crate trained and house trained, although he will likely need time to adjust to a new home. He is a wonderful dog waiting patiently for a loving family.

For more information on the EHS adoption process please visit our website, or for further details on Cisco please email mgy.ehs@gmail.com.

Teddy is currently in foster so please email jleung.ehs@gmail.com if you would like to set up a time to meet him.

Hi there! My name is Teddy, but you can call me Teddy Bear because I am  so cute. I am a 6 year old shih-tzu. I love people and will happily wag my tail for you if you come and meet me. Everyone says I am a real cuddle-bug. I enjoy walks but after that, I'm happy to sit with you and read a good book or watch some TV. I want you all to myself so if you have another pet, I am sorry but I prefer not to share you. If you teach me, I will not mind having doggy friends to play with sometimes though. I sleep in my crate and I am a big boy so no need to worry about me 'going' inside the house. Come and meet me!

For more information about the EHS adoption process please visit our website.

Applications are now closed for Danny due to overwhelming response

This handsome sweet boy is Bruce who is approx. 8 years old and is full of love and fun

 Bruce has dry-eye which will need drops every day twice a day for life which is approx. 25.00 per month

 Bruce is sweet, housetrained, good with other dogs, good in the car, friendly with people, no handling issues and just an overall well mannered guy

 loves going for walks and gets excited for one and is ready anytime for one

 this nice boy will be an amazing addition to any family!

Charlie is a cute and fun loveable dog who is full of energy and, at 10 months old, he is at that rascal stage.

  

 He went through puppy classes and will benefit from continued training, leadership (parenting), and boundaries so he grows into a well-behaved adult dog. 

  

 Charlie is living with a few dogs now and likes being around them. One in particular is his play buddy and they wrestle and mouth each other, lie together and play, play and play some more. His buddy is an adult dog who enjoys and is tolerant of Charlie's attention.

  

 Having some good doggie friends and/or being in well supervised play groups would be terrific for Charlie.

  

 Charlie may have had some negative experiences in the past, as he can be vocal (barks) and reactive on leash when he sees other dogs. Regardless, with a little work Charlie can be taught to ignore them. And with some time to build a bit of trust, Charlie can meet dogs appropriately. We have greeted various friendly dogs on leash, circling with the dogs to avoid tension and ending up with a good, positive interaction after a few seconds.

  

 His interactions with people are somewhat similar. He is very cute which can result in people rushing up or being too quick to reach out to him. However, given a slower introduction without pressure, Charlie is better (as most dogs are). 

  

 Charlie has shown a tendency to guard some items. His foster mom can suggest training games to help this which will counter-condition his response.

  

  

 We are looking for an adult home or one with older responsible children as he was originally in a home with a small child and things did not work well for his previous family or Charlie because of it.

  

 Charlie has some things to work through but is at a terrific age to avoid anything developing into a lifelong issue. Charlie's new home will need to guide him and provide careful socialization with dogs and people. It will require commitment, patience and supervision but he has the basis of a fabulous companion. Charlie is a sweet dog who is approximately 30 pounds and has been fully vetted.

Jack

 Hey you herding breed lovers meet Jack! 

  

 Jack came into a local animal shelter last fall as a stray and has now been in foster care for a few months. He is guessed to be about 5 years old and is housetrained.

  

 Jack is hoping to find a special human to strongly bond with and to play fetch and go on long walks with. His ideal home would be a quieter environment without a lot of activity or people coming and going.

  

 Jack's instinct is to bark and sometimes charge/chase moving objects in his environment like bicycles, skateboards, strollers, and joggers. He may also bark/lunge at strangers who move towards him or move too quickly. He is more nervous of males than females. With management and training in his foster home he is doing well while out and about in the neighbourhood but will require ongoing help with these triggers.

  

 Jack is looking for a home with experience working with and training fearful/reactive dogs using counter conditioning, desensitization, and positive reinforcement. A female guardian would be easier for Jack, however, interested male adopters with the aforementioned experience will be considered.

  

 Jack is not suitable for apartment living as he can be quite vocal or a home with children under the age of 15. 

  

 Jack is an affectionate and snuggly guy who will thrive in a home that keeps him feeling safe and manages his interactions to set him up for success.

Bobby is an adorable eight year old neutered male Maltese who loves people. He loves them so much that he needs to be around them most of the time. His favourite people are boys but they shouldn't be too young. Bobby has been known to nip if he gets scared. He has lived with children and has always been gentle and tolerant of them, but if he feels threatened he needs to say "get away". He enjoys walks, walks well on a leash, and is happy to meet other small dogs, though when he sees big dogs he becomes very afraid. Bobby doesn't like loud noises like thunder and fireworks, and isn't a big fan of dog parks. He loves snuggles and treats. He has a history of dental problems and has had two surgeries to remove and clean his teeth. This is the only health issue he has ever had. While Bobby is house trained he will sometimes soil in the house if left alone too long, out of fear, and can't be trusted around carpet. Bobby does not like being left in a crate and shouldn't be put in one. Bobby has previously been on medication for anxiety, with no change in his emotional state. He used to have brother, who passed away, but was still just as anxious with a dog brother for company. Bobby is good in a car and can handle road trips. Bobby is a great companion dog and would be well suited in a home with retired owners or in a setting where his owners work from home.

Jessie is a calm senior neutered male. In his recent past, he's lived in far too many places since his owner could no longer care for him. Not his fault--he's just plain wonderful! 

 He's fine with cats. He doesn't chase squirrels or rabbits. He can be trusted to be home alone. He doesn't need a crate, and he doesn't have have accidents in the house. He doesn't jump on furniture. He doesn't guard food or toys. He has manners and learns house rules quickly. He's great in the car and waits patiently for permission to jump out. He's content to lay at your feet, gaze into your eyes and grin at you. His hearing is limited, but he's always in tune visually. He thrives in a calm environment and is enjoying the new experience of having canine companions to explore in the yard or laze in the house.

 Is he perfect? Absolutely not. 

 The problem with Jesse is...he'll steal your heart. 

 For a long time Jessie had an ear infection that went untreated, his ears were very sore. When Jessie went to the vet for his exam his ear condition was discovered and treated; he is still sensitive when touched around his ears and can be reactive so foster mom goes slow and steady when putting in his drops.

 He may not hear as well as he used to but his other senses are still keen and he even does does sprints to the door when he sees his foster mom is holding a yummy treat.

 Jessie would be best suited to an adult only home and could be either a house or an apartment as he's a quiet mannerly gent

Sweet pup Luna is a six-month old Shepherd mix who was originally purchased from an internet website and not wanted by all the family members 

 so she ended up with Speaking of Dogs Rescue 

 a lovely dog, Luna is friendly with strangers, appears to be housetrained, has puppy energy but has had some training already, she is good with other dogs and needs work with jumping and walking in a mannerly fashion (although not that bad at all for a young dog)

 the applications we are looking for would be an energetic adopter who has time and dog experience; a house would be ideal but she could live in an apartment if the adopters were committed to taking her out walking and if working, getting a dog walker

 She is approx. 35 pounds only

Odessa is a beautiful medium-haired Russian Blue cross who was rescued from a wood pile, along with her five kittens â Caspian, Jules, Nereida, Nerissa and Hadrian.  
Although she has adjusted well to living indoors, she remains somewhat timid and prefers to watch the action from a distance.  
She will allow herself to be petted, but does not like being picked up.

Odessa would do well in a quiet home without small children, and with someone who is willing to let her blossom in her own time.

 DOB April 12, 2012

Triscilla, such a lovely face. Such a soft coat. The poor little girl has been down on her luck, but that's all turning around, now that she's an Abbey Cat. She was mercilessly dumped in a colony and being attacked by other cats before we rescued her.

Triscilla is still recovering from this streak of bad luck, but she's a survivor. She has found a lovely foster home with a gentle young woman, and is now sleeping with her at night and enjoying daytime naps under the comforter. She really likes to hang out with her foster mom, getting pets and giving head butts. More treats, please! Open the door, please! Are you finished with those Guinea pigs yet? I'm feeling lonely over here! Her other passion is watching the action on the street from the window sill. It ain't all it's cracked up to be out there!

Because of her recent troubles,Triscilla needs a quiet home with a patient, gentle family (no dogs or small children). She may prefer to be an only-cat. 
In the right home, without a doubt, she will reward her human(s) with utter devotion.

If Triscilla sounds like a cat with whom you could share your life please fill out an adoption application http://abbeycats.org/adoption-application.html or call 416 284 2140 today.

Maverick & his brother, Madison arrived from the cold, and given what they've been through their lucky foster home can't believe how quickly they adjusted. 
They have been through a lot during their short lives, but in spite of this they clearly love people and are trying every day to overcome their fears, and connect to the people around them. 
Every day they are becoming more affectionate. They are quiet and very chill, and LOVE head rubs. 
They are the most stunning cats their foster mom has ever seen! 
They do well around other cats (and have quickly won over the resident cat). 
They are a bit timid around dogs, but are doing great with the resident German Shep. 
Their foster family is falling in love with them quickly, and they melt the hearts of anyone who meets them. 
They have clearly been through some hardships, and tend to reassure each other in times of stress that humans are not so bad after all! 
They are a most stunning pair, and will make some family out there one lucky bunch! 
They have been waiting quite a long time for a forever family. They are really shy around strangers so it's hard to fully express what love bugs they are when thye know "their" people. Madison developed a minor food allergy which prevented them from being available for adoption till we could figure out his issue. Now they are both and would love nothing more than to find their family. They love head rubs and just hanging with people.
They would love to find a home together.

 If Lina feels she is being loved, then she starts trusting her surroundings.

She gets along well with other kitties and is now ready for adoption.

Life is so sweet with you, forever be so loving true, sweet with you. - Macy Gray "Sweet Baby"
Like the lyrics to a Macy Gray song, this little lady just wants to spend her time being the best companion she can be.

Macey is very shy with strangers and will hide when new people come into the home. 

Her foster parent describes Macey as affectionate, loving and curious however it takes time for Macey to warm up to new people.
She's always happy to greet you in the morning, and gets along well with her bulldog foster sister.
Macey would be happiest in a home without other cats as she wants all your attention for herself.

Her hobbies include gardening, fishing and finding warm places to sit and watch the world go by!

If you're looking for a sweet, active and loving kitty, come and meet Miss Macey.

hea was rescued from a hoarder where she spent her days locked in a cage in a shed.
Since rescue she has blossomed into a sweet little girl. Once she knows you she likes to come and get cuddles and gives lots of loving headbutts. 
She does frighten easily and will run for cover when she hears an unfamiliar sound. 
She will quickly recover from this and be back out for more attention. 
She loves being with other kitties. You can often find her snuggled up with one. They give her great comfort.

Thea and Zachary are bonded; they absolutely love each other!!!! 

They love cuddling and cleaning each other and if they aren't greeting their foster mother at the door when she walks in, she can certainly find them cuddled on the bed in a pretzel-like position.

They are good with dogs, (we're unsure about children though) but Thea loves kittens. Zachary does not mind other cats, but he's not too fond of other kittens
Zachary loves giving kisses to his humans and Thea is timid around other people/new faces. 
If someone other than her foster mother is in her bedroom Thea will hide under the bed.

These two LOVE to chase their foster mother in the morning and hunt her down for treats. 
Thea is the Cookie Monster (as she is a tad chubby) and Zachary follows her lead. Thea will stare at her foster mother and give a soft meow and squint until she gets her treat!! 
From the time her foster mother's feet hit the floor, Thea is there!

Zachary brings Thea out of her shell as it takes her a little longer to warm up to and trust people.
Zachary on the other hand is very loving and will quickly charm strangers... even pizza delivery men!!

They have opposite personalities but bring the best out in each other!!

Thea and Zachary are very fond of each other and would like to be adopted together - in order to make this happen, we are letting them go 2 for the price of 1 adoption fee.

Ella is still looking for her forever home. While she has garnered a lot of interest based on her undeniably gorgeous looks and silky, long grey hair she has yet to find the perfect fit. 
Thus far none of her potential adopters have been both able to provide a quiet home and are prepared for the patience and understanding that will be needed to help this shy gal.

Ella is a wonderful, loving and playful young cat but she is also incredibly timid and easily scared. 
She is most frightened by unfamiliar noises, quick movements and at night. 
She takes a lot of comfort in being around other, more confident cats who will cuddle her after she has been spooked. 
Although she has made a good amount of progress in her foster home, moving will inevitably result in new, unfamiliar noises, sights and smells that she will need to adjust to.

When she gets past her nerves, she loves all things love: pets, scratches, belly rubs, cuddles, being talked to and being brushed. 
Though not bonded, her favourite cat is her buddy Lyndall who introduces her to lots of new things like flip flop wrestling, laying in the herb planters and how to best get springs in the water bowl. 
Her favourite toys are whatever toys her people or fellow cats will play with with her.

Diandra was rescued from a hoarder who kept her locked up in a cage. 
She's a social girl, she must have been very lonely.
She loves other kitties and people. She even gets along with dogs. Diandra often waits in the window for you to come home and greets you at the door.
Fill out an adoption application http://abbeycats.org/adoption-application.html 
or call 416 284 2140 to meet Diandra today!
****She needs to have another kitty friend or friends for company

Hazelle has a luxurious, silky coat of, arresting colours and stripes with large, eloquent and revelatory green eyes.
 
At first, she a reserved soul with whom it takes a bit of time and patience in order for her to relax around you; to trust you.
One of her favorite diversions is to sit on a windowsill, overlooking the garden and watch the goings on while she sniffs the breezes and if the day is not too hot, she will always find the one spot on the floor where the sun hits to curl up in.
She will most often like to be near you, but prefers not to sit on top of you, your laptop or your book!
She is an exceptional communicator who likes âconversationsâ.
She is not a noisome yowler but rather has a range of chirps which all have distinctive meanings .
Although she is more of a serene, solitary Lady, when she comes to chat, she has no problem letting herself and her meanings be known with her body language, her soulful chirping and explicitly expressive eyes.
While she will tolerate being picked up to be moved, she is not the sort of lady who likes to be handled and petted.
She does revel in being brushed or petted when she is already lying down.
 
Hazelle would do best in a home without young children or dogs
 
Hazelle will be spayed before she's adopted out.

Lyndall is ready to take the plunge and commit to a forever home!  This little lady had a rough start to life; From six to nine weeks old her and her brother Logan were kept in a carrier in the hallway of a shelter all but ignored.  As a result, they were terrified of people, deemed unmanageable and slated for euthanasia.  But Abbey Cats wouldn't let them be written off!

While Lyndall's brother Logan came around faster than anyone could have anticipated and went off to his forever home, Lyndall had to stay behind and put in extra work to figure out not all humans are bad.  

It may take her awhile to warm up, but she is well worth the wait.  She approaches everything like a kitten: cautious, curious, excited and energetic.  She enjoys exploring every nook and cranny of her home to find the best perches and hiding spots and zooming around playing with other cats and whatever toys she can get her paws on.  

Lyndall will do best in a home with someone patient and understanding of all she's been through.  A home with sociable, confident cats is a must.  She will tolerate dogs, but not small children.

Cheska and her siblings Chazz, Corday, Charelston and Cinci were rescued from a shelter when they were only a few days old

This shy quiet heart is the biggest sweetheart of them all.
Although a little skittish, Cheska is sure to stay close to anyone she attaches too.

With love and patience, she is sure to be a wonderful companion.
Even though she is shy, she gets along great with her siblings and loves to play.

Cheska is a great addition to a nice quiet household.
Cheska would do well being adopted with one of her siblings.
 
****Please bear in mind that it is against Abbey Cat policy to adopt a single kitten under the age of 6 months to a home without a kitten of similar age for company.****

DOB: June 1 2014

Thetis was found in a garden shed in late March...very pregnant.
She was taken to a shelter and had her 5 kittens there, then they were all taken to a foster home where they've been well taken care of.
The kittens have all gone to their new homes now and now it's their mom's turn.
Thetis has silky black fur and beautiful green eyes.
She's a bit shy with new people (not unusual for homeless cats) but soon gets over that; then she's very friendly and loves to be petted.
She also enjoys playing with toys now that her kittens aren't taking up so much of her time.
Once Thetis gets to know you, she is a loving and playful companion.
 
She is making great strides and blossoming in her foster home, to the point where's she's even sat quietly beside her foster mom and begged for tickles and attention while purring.
When one of her foster sister cats wandered in to the room, Thetis watched carefully but wasn't alarmed and they actually sat together quite comfortably.
A little bit later, after an exploration expedition, Thetis was found under a bed sitting beside the other resident cat.
It looks as though Thetis will be OK with both people and other cats as long as she is given time.

Triscilla was mercilessly dumped in a colony and being attacked by other cats before she was rescued by Abbey Cats.

Thankfully she is all recovered now! Triscilla has a sweet face with cute, big eyes. Her fur is super soft too!

Her foster mother says âsleeping with her is the best!â

Triscilla will meow and welcome you back home! You can even hear her when you walk up to the door and put your keys in the lock.

She will rush to greet and talk to you.Talk? You may ask. But yes, she loves to talk to you, when you get home, when you have salmon for dinner, when you are readying her mealâ¦  she is always meowing! She is a super talkative cat, and you have to be sure you are answering her too.

Triscilla has a lot of personality.

She loves to have her fur combed and prefers to have this done in an area where there is lots of light so she can show off her beauty.

Triscilla understands that sleeping on top of a keyboard is a struggle to humans, so in order to compromise and still be close; she will sit on the mouse.

When sheâs not being playful and active, she loves to explore new spots in which to sleep

Triscilla has been doing really well in her foster home, where she is allowed to be the boss!

In return, she gives her foster family lots of love.

Triscilla needs a quiet home with a patient, gentle family (no dogs)

If this very loving and chatty girl (who is a great conversationalist and fantastic company) sounds like the perfect permanent pal for you please fill out an adoption application to arrange a meet and greet today!

 

*****We have no experience of Triscilla with younger children but she'd be fine if they were taught to be respectful of animals******

Are you looking for a spunky, fearless little kitten? Well Rerun is your boy then! 
This purring machine loves to be where all the action is...racing up and down the cat trees, wrestling with his siblings, chasing the laser light or trying to be the first to catch the sprocket toy. 
This handsome kitten is sure to have his new family laughing all the time with his little antics and when the days are done he will love nothing more than to snuggle with his human!

Dreamboat Annie can be a little shy at first, but when she knows that she is in a safe place with loving people she relaxes and becomes a wonderful companion. 
She likes to sit beside humans when they are watching TV or reading, and she l-o-v-e-s to have her thick, plush coat brushed. 
If you pass near to her when she is resting, she will meow softly to remind you that she loves to be stroked and tickled! 
She will make a wonderful addition to any family where there is a lot of love and another cat for company. 

Call now to meet her!
Dreamboat Annie and Heart are good buddies and would like to be adopted together.

Heart is a sweet, gentle little soul who would love to have her own home and human love that she can count on for the rest of her life.  What makes her a "Special Cat" is that she's very nervous about meeting new people and facing changes.  Although people have come to see her, she tries to hide and refuses to show her affectionate, playful nature. 
 
Her potential adopters haven't seen her running around happily with her favourite ball in her mouth; they haven't experienced her pushing her head into the palm of their hand so that they can tickle her ears; they haven't heard her purring beside them as they drift off to sleep at night. They haven't laughed as they watch her wriggle on her back and sides so that she can be brushed everywhere, or seen the pleading in her eyes when she knows that treats are being handed out.
 
She is a very special cat who just doesn't have the confidence that wins other cats good loving homes.  Do you have the understanding and the  patience to reassure her?

Heart and Dreamboat Annie are good buddies and would like to be adopted together.

Geri is an independent soul who likes to be the center of attention.

She is friendly and will get your undivided attention by rubbing against your legs or chirping at you until you pet her.

She has a dominant personality and definitely likes to be the boss if other dogs or cats are around.
She has fulfilled her role as proud Mom to three beautiful kittens and is now ready to move on to the next chapter of her life in a home that will spoil her with love and attention.

She is a 'reserved' cat but with a little time, she will make a great companion.
Geri's foster mother describes her as " part guard dog, she takes an interest in whatever is going on in the hallway or the outside balconies"

Most Abbey Cats have sad or tragic stories, but William and Hari have found themselves in an especially heart-breaking situation.
Their owner loves them dearly, but has had to move into a nursing home and she could not take them with her. 
Because of illness she has gone from a loving owner to someone having difficulty remembering to feed them or provide basic care
The family is heartbroken but cannot provide a home for them because of severe allergies, o they have appealed to Abbey Cats for help.
Their home is currently being packed up around them and the cats are bewildered and unhappy and obviously missing their still loving human.
It will ease her mind considerably to know her cats have found new loving homes 
Although they are companions, they are not bonded and can be adopted separately.

Hari is a soft and gentle grey and white girl who is not quite 2 years old. Because she's partially blind (she was born this way), she'll be a little shy at first, but when she's familiar with her surroundings and family she will become very affectionate. 
She loves to be brushed and cuddled, and she communicates her appreciation with her unique, squeaky little voice.


Please look for her under Special Cats at Abbey Cats. http://abbeycats.org/index.php/special-cats.html

William is a regal and elegant 8-year-old Seal Point Siamese who loves to be brushed, and enjoys âtalkingâ to humans.

Ciara is very gentle and loves everyone she meets.
She is a very calm cat who likes to lounge wherever the people are.
Ciara does not get along well with other cats so she would prefer to be alone.
She would be good with kids but would probably prefer to stay away from them if they are very grabby and high energy.

description.$t:
Sophie is such a delightful kittie who is 10 months old. 
She is full of life, loves to play and is interested in her surroundings and what her humans are doing. 
She will follow you around and is curious about everything. 
She is a lap cat who is quite cuddly. 
While not a big talker, Sophie enjoys a good chat. 
She is an extraverted kittie with a good sense of adventure.  
She loves to sleep under the covers in bed.

Sophie becomes shy and will draw back if your hands move too quickly toward her. Slow is better. 
As such, she would probably not do well in a home with small children who are new to living with cats. 
Sophie would probably be OK in a home with another young cat due to her love of play. 

She would also do well as a single cat as she equally enjoys human interaction and is a lap cat and is also somewhat independent.

If you are interested in adopting Sophie, a hold can be placed on her and she will be able to leave Abbey Cats after she is spayed at the end of August.
